required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Performance Evaluation of 3D Ear Canal Scanning Technology
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Performance Evaluation of 3D Ear Canal Scanning Technology

brief_summary.textblock: Study participants will undergo ear canal impressions in a standard of care protocol utilizing two methodologies: 3D ear scanning using a commercially-available ear scanning device, and conventional silicone impression material. The elapsed time of each procedure will be captured for each participant, and the average duration of the two methodologies will be compared.

primary_outcome.description: The total time required to complete each impression methodology according to a standard of care procedure.

secondary_outcome.description: Subjective/qualitative feedback from participant on each impression methodology when performed according to standard of care procedure.

arm_group.description: All participants will have bilateral impressions taken with both methodologies.

intervention.description: A commercially-available ear scanning device used according to standard of care.
A two part silicon impression material that is used to fill the ear and produce a physical cast of the ear canal. The procedure is standard of care.

study_pop.textblock: Adults with anatomically typical external auditory canals/meatus who have any degree, type, and configuration of hearing impairment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Hearing impairment (any degree, type, and configuration)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Absent or abnormal external auditory canal and/or external auditory meatus.
- Positive history of external/middle ear surgery.
